abstract: Rescue crews work feverishly to find trapped survivors of deadly earthquake in eastern Turkey that killed at least 279 people and injured more than 1,300; government has set aside about $1.7 million in disaster aid, and donations of money and supplies are coming from civilian groups and private donors.
snippet: At least 279 people were killed and more than 1,300 were injured after a magnitude 7.2 earthquake shook eastern Turkey, close to its border with Iran.
lead_paragraph: At least 279 people were killed and more than 1,300 were injured after a magnitude 7.2 earthquake shook eastern Turkey, close to its border with Iran.

headline.main: In Turkey, Desperate Race to Find Trapped Survivors
headline.print_headline: In Turkey, Desperate Race To Find Trapped Survivors
headline.seo: Turkey Searches for Trapped Earthquake Survivors
